page.title: 04TRAFFIC PROBLEMS IN SEAHAM
page.content: FOR A LONG TIME PEOPLE IN SEAHAM HAVE BEEN WORRIED ABOUT THE HEAVY LORRIES AND TANKERS USING THE ROADS.TO KEEP THESE VEHICLES AWAY FROM HOUSES AND PEOPLE CERTAIN RULES HAVE BEEN INTRODUCED.NO HEAVY GOODS VEHICLES ARE ALLOWED TO TRAVEL ALONG THE AVENUE OR STATION ROAD UNLESS THEY NEED TO DELIVER OR LOAD GOODS.THEY MUST USE LORD BYRON'S WALK.THIS IS A PITY AS THIS ROAD IS A PICTURESQUE RAMBLE TO THE BEACH.THEY CAN ALSO USE THE NEW BY-PASS ROAD,BUILT IN 1978 AND PARTLY FINANCED BY THE EUROPEAN ECONOMIC COMMUNITY.WE HAVE A LARGE PROPORTION OF LORRIES VISITING THE COLLIERIES , THE DOCKS,THE FACTORIES,BUILDING SITES AND GARAGES.UPON LEAVING SEAHAM THE LORRIES CAN USE THE A19 TRUNK ROAD TO TRAVEL NORTH OR SOUTH OR THE B1404 TO GO WEST.
